webhooks:add.description:
add a webhook to an app
Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:add -i api:dyno -l notify -u https://example.com/hooks

include.name: include
include.description: comma delimited event types your server will receive

level.name: level
level.description: notify does not retry, sync will retry until successful or timeout

secret.name: secret
secret.description: value to sign delivery with in Heroku-Webhook-Hmac-SHA256 header

authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: authoriation header to send with webhooks

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

webhooks.description:
list webhooks on an app
Example:

 $ heroku webhooks

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

webhooks:info.description:
info for a webhook on an app
Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:info 99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999

pipeline.name: pipeline
pipeline.description: pipeline on which to show info

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

webhooks:remove.description:
removes a webhook from an app
Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:remove 99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

webhooks:update.description:
updates a webhook in an app
Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:update 99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999 -i dyno -l notify -s 09928c40bf1b191b645174a19f7053d16a180da37332e719ef0998f4c0a2 -u https://example.com/hooks

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:events

Example:

Example:
